ol.li:
Check symptoms of hanging trauma by a trained First Aid Responder:
Paleness
Sweating
Shortness of breath
Increase in pulse and blood pressure
Visual impairment
Dizziness
Nausea
Later drop in pulse and blood pressure

If there is no massive bleeding, the person is not unconscious and there is no respiratory arrest, the patient should first be positioned with the upper body raised and legs drawn up in a squatting or crouching position.
First move slowly into flat storage.
If there are no signs of hanging trauma after the rescue, the normal first aid measures should be carried out.
